metatags.twitter:title: Coolest thing I have ever seen
metatags.og:title: Coolest thing I have ever seen
metatags.og:description: In Mackanaw City (MI), they have had a very cold winter.  The lake (Michigan) is heavily frozen.  Recently a crack in the ice developed (under pressure) and a huge wave erupted.  But, because the water was “fresh” (i.e., non salty, for those in AZ 😉 ), it, pretty much instantly froze (water,under pressure, has a higher freezing point)  The result, these huge, frozen waves.  Enjoy;

Enjoy;

videoobject.name: NOAA scientist discusses Great Lakes ice with ABC7
videoobject.description: ABC7 Meteorologist Larry Mowry sits down with James Kessler, Physical Scientist with the NOAA Great Lakes Environmental Research Lab, to discuss ice on the Great Lakes this winter.
ABC 7 Chicago Meteorologist Cheryl Scott explains what Lake Michigan's pancake ice is and how it forms.
